title: Setup security scanning with Safety and Bandit
description: Configure Safety for dependency vulnerability scanning and Bandit for security issue detection in code. Integrate into pre-commit hooks and CI pipeline for automated security checks.

comments.author: jared@goatbytes.io
comments.content:
Setup security scanning with Safety and Bandit:

**Makefile Targets:**
- `make security`: Run Bandit (code security) and Safety (dependency vulnerabilities)
- `make security-audit`: Generate detailed JSON reports (bandit-report.json, safety-report.json)
- Updated `make clean` to remove security reports

**CI/CD Integration:**
- Added security job to GitHub Actions workflow (.github/workflows/ci.yml)
- Runs Bandit and Safety on every PR and push to main
- Safety continues on error to not block builds on minor issues

**Configuration:**
- Bandit config already in pyproject.toml:
  - Excludes tests/ and .venv/
  - Skips B101 (assert_used) for tests
- Safety and Bandit already in [tool.poetry.group.security.dependencies]

**Security Policy:**
- Created SECURITY.md with:
  - Vulnerability reporting process (security@goatbytes.io)
  - Response timelines (48h initial, 7d update)
  - Security best practices (API keys, dependencies, input validation)
  - Scanning instructions and tools documentation
  - Automated scanning schedule

**VS Code Tasks:**
- Added 'Security Scan' task
- Added 'Security Audit (Full Report)' task

**Documentation:**
- Updated docs/development.md with security scanning section

**.gitignore:**
- Added bandit-report.json and safety-report.json

Security scanning now integrated into development workflow and CI/CD pipeline.
